Microeconomics | Part D

Homework D | MiniExam D

Reading

Start with Chapter 6, Chapter 8, Chapter 9, Chapter 11, and Chapter 12. I always recommend skimming first to develop an understanding of the scope of what's being discussed. Then reread in more detail.

Once you've finished reading, take a look at the practice material and use the text as a resource when you need help. This way, you know what's most important, get to practicing quickly, and know where to find help when you innevitably get stuck.

Homework D Demo Solutions

Homework D Demo is similar to Homework D. The best approach is to start by trying to solve it on your own. Posted on Friday morning, sorry for the delay.

Homework D

Homework D covers everything in Part D and is due on Friday October 21.

Vignette D

Vignette D is a little story of a public good we covered in class.

MiniExam D Demo

MiniExam D Demo is very similar to what you'll see on MiniExam D. Solutions will be posted on Sunday evening.

This is a resource for you to use as you'd like. But here's my advice. Start by trying to solve MiniExam D Demo on your own. Then once you've worked through everything as best you're able, use the video and solutions to check your work. You're more than welcome to watch this video first, but you're not going to catch your weak points as easily, which is the main point.

MiniExam D

MiniExam D will be held on Tuesday October 25 and covers everything in Part D. If you're able to do the work in the Homework and Homework Demo, understand the concepts, and can solve the MiniExam Demo, you're going to be in good shape.
